note.title: Social Engineering
note.content:
## ğŸ§  Human Vectors / Social Engineering
Attacks exploiting human psychology to gain unauthorized access or sensitive info.

### Phishing ğŸ“§
- Spray and pray attacks using deceptive emails.
- **Spear Phishing:** Targeted users.
- **Whaling:** Targets high-profile executives (CEOs, CFOs).
- **Vishing:** Phone-based attacks.
- **Smishing:** Text message attacks.

### Misinformation / Fraud ğŸ’°
- **Misinformation:** Unintentional false info.
- **Disinformation:** Intentional false info.
- **Identity Fraud:** Using someone else's info to deceive.
- **Invoice Scam:** Fake invoices to trick victims.

### Impersonation ğŸ•µï¸
- Assuming anotherâ€™s identity to gain access.
- **Business Email Compromise:** Manipulating employees via internal emails.
- **Pretexting:** Fabricated scenario to extract info.
- **Brand Impersonation:** Pretending to represent a legit company.
- **Typosquatting:** Using domain names with typos to trick users.

### Targeted Attacks ğŸ¯
- **Watering Hole:** Compromise websites your target uses.
- **Diversion Theft:** Distract to steal info.
- **Hoax:** Malicious deception via social media/email.

### Physical / Observational Attacks ğŸ‘€
- **Shoulder Surfing:** Watching someone to gather info.
- **Dumpster Diving:** Searching trash for sensitive info.
- **Eavesdropping:** Secretly listening.
- **Baiting:** Leaving malware-infected devices (USBs) for victims to pick up.

sourceNote.title: CompTIA Security+
sourceNote.content:
### ğŸ›¡ï¸ CompTIA Security+ (SY0-701)
#### ğŸ“… Exam Date: September 7, 2025
#### â³ Study Duration: About 1.5 months
#### ğŸ“„ Study Notes
[Download Security+ Study Notes PDF](/pdf/CompTIA Security+.pdf)

### â­ Why I Pursued Security+
CompTIA Security+ was my first step into building a strong cybersecurity foundation. I used it to learn core security concepts, and strengthen my knowledge for future internships.

### ğŸ“˜ Key Domains & Important Topics
 Below are the most valuable Security+ topics. Many link to deeper notes. 
#### ğŸ” Domain 1 â€” General Security Concepts
- [[CIA Triad]] 
- [[Security Controls]] 
- [[Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA)]] 
- [[Zero Trust Model]] 
- [[PKI & Encryption]] 
#### ğŸ§ª Domain 2 â€” Threats, Vulnerabilities & Mitigations 
- [[Common Threat Actors]] 
- [[Social Engineering]] 
- [[Malware Types]] 
- [[Vulnerability Types]] 
#### ğŸŒ Domain 3 â€” Security Architecture 
- [[Defense in Depth]] 
- [[Secure Network Segmentation]] 
- [[Data Protection]] 
#### ğŸ–¥ï¸ Domain 4 â€” Security Operations 
- [[Secure Baselines & Hardening]] 
- [[Vulnerability Management Lifecycle]] 
- [[Identity and Access Management (IAM)]] 
- [[Incident Response Process]]
#### âš™ï¸ Domain 5 â€” Security Program Management and Oversight 
- [[Security Policies]] 
- [[Risk Management]] 
- [[Audits & Assessments]] 
- [[Security Awareness Training]] 

### ğŸ§° Resources
#### ğŸ¥ Video Courses
- Jason Dion â€“ CompTIA Security+ Full Course (Udemy)
- CyberCraft â€“ Security+ PBQ Playlist (YouTube)
- Cyber James â€“ Security+ Practice Test Videos (YouTube)
#### ğŸ“˜ Practice Exams
- Jason Dion â€“ Practice Exam Sets (Udemy)
- ExamCompass Security+ Practice Tests
- TechExam.pro â€“ Security+ Full Practice Exams 
### ğŸ›£ï¸ My Personal Tips  
 1. **Understand concepts, donâ€™t memorize answers.** 
 2. **Do 500â€“700 practice questions minimum.** 
 3. **Use multiple sources, not one.**
